text:
I'd go with HubDB, put the author data in some table, you could have them in some spreadsheet and then import data – author images are a bit difficult to import though b/c you need the files *somewhere* but I think it's a coin toss if it's worth it to build some API thingy to upload image, get it's URI, then do a HubDB update with the author data instead of doing that thing manually.

Of course if the images are hosted elsewhere then you'd just use that URI in the data.

HubDB takes in CSV imports so if you need it done by Friday I think it means leg work. Also tell someone that Fridays are not good launch days. Tuesdays are good. Then you try to get it done by Friday, and still have Monday to do some testing and final adjustments, and most of the time Fridays no-one cares about your thing...

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/files/files>
Anyone else having issues with the hs fetch command?
hi <@UGDF9EBPW> :slightly_smiling_face: leuk om de concurrent te zien!
Concullega’s noemen we dat toch? :joy:
<@U039VA3GR17> Ervaren jullie ook problemen?
Haha, maakt mij allemaal niet uit, als we maar het beste bij elkaar omhoog halen :+1:
Helemaal mee eens!
Waar heb je problemen mee Teun?
Specifiek het fetchen van een bestand
Uploaden werkt verder prima
zover ik zie geen problemen
To be precise, whenever I try to fetch either the meta.json or the fields.json, I get an empty result.

hi guys,,,
for every one of you who's experiencing the fetch issues today in HubSpot CLI,
you can post your report here,  so that the HubSpot devs will escalate this issue further and it will be solved quickly by them.

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Dashboards-Reporting/Cannnot-fetch-to-my-projects-quot-Client-Error-issue-quot/m-p/604938#M5505>
Seems to be working again
Thank you for reporting this. We found an issue preventing fetch from working properly which has been fixed. `hs fetch` should now be working properly.
Yeah, heads up guys, fetch is now working again.

Hi everyone.

І’m looking to scale my services and wondering if HubSpot CMS is a good fit.

My main specialization is custom templates for Shopify and Squarespace. 5+ years experience.
I checked out HubSpot and really enjoyed the dev process. Especially after Squarespace, lol.

So, I’m wondering how easy it is to find a project on HubSpot CMS and what is the average hourly rate for developers.

Feel free to DM me.
Thanks.

<@U3T21PDBK>, <@UGDF9EBPW> :point_up_2:
thoughts for our new friend? :grin:
Is there an article regarding how a team might set up different HubSpot isntances and apps and use them to get from dev => staging => production?

has anyone used their HubSpot website to relay sensitive data? I know you cant store data like a social security number in HubSpot but you can still send that data elsewhere from within your HubSpot website right? Just curious if anyone has ever run into this problem and how you solved it

<@U7SL518D6> <@UD53A9UUR> It looks like every HubSpot site with a path path of `/_hcms/forms/`  redirects to `<https://developers.HubSpot.com/>` Id like to think its not a sneaky way of HS getting a bunch of SEO street cred on the sly :stuck_out_tongue:
But it happens with literally every HS hosted site that I visit
wanna shoot me a sample?

<https://www.thesilverlining.com/_hcms/forms/>
<https://www.streamcreative.com/_hcms/forms/>
brilliant
did you create your developer account :laughing:

Looking for a way to add text to a form in-between the form fields and the submit button. I have to use an existing form so I can’t directly to this without editing it where it is used on other pages. Is there a way to inject text?
If you can’t modify the form (where text is a valid field) then the only option you’re going to have is injecting content via JS
Hi all, is there a way to sync a MYSQL database table with HubDB. Basically making sure the HubDB is a mirror of the MYSQL database
